title.narrative: RESPONSE PLAN COVID-19

description.narrative: Response Plan COVID-19, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care (Covid), Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Response Plan COVID-19

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to strengthening institutional as well as local communities’ response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. This involved enhanced coordination and improved institutional capacities of government stakeholders (Ministry of Health (MoH), Ministry of Education (MoE) and community engagement and resiliency, mainly to promote and ensure a safe return to schools, as well as to support the national vaccination campaign. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2022
